###  AmeriServ Account Campaign Supports Area Breast Cancer Awareness Efforts, Patient Needs

November 15, 2024

**Johnstown, PA (NASDAQ: ASRV)** **–** AmeriServ Bank announced today that it has donated $5,000 to the Windber, PA-based Joyce Murtha Breast Care Center as part of its annual October account opening campaign. The donation will help fund the Center’s Pink Ribbon Care, a program that assists patients who are unable to pay for breast-related health services including mammograms, follow-up diagnostic services and genetic counseling.For every savings or checking account that opened throughout the month of October, AmeriServ pledged to donate $25 to the Joyce Murtha Breast Care Center and continue to support the fight against breast cancer. “This is the fifth year that we’ve held the campaign, and the response continues to be tremendous,” Susan Tomera Angeletti, AmeriServ senior vice president – marketing and alternative delivery, said. “Our partnership with the Joyce Murtha Breast Care Center is helping people living within our communities gain access to the medical treatment they need. We are honored to work with the Center and to promote the invaluable services they bring to our area.”Since introducing its account opening campaign in 2020, AmeriServ Bank has donated $25,000 to the Joyce Murtha Breast Care Center. Erin Goins, Director of Women’s Services for Chan Soon-Shiong Medical Center at Windber, said “AmeriServ Bank’s generous support of the Joyce Murtha Breast Care Center will allow us to provide services to our patients who may normally delay or skip vital appointments due to financial hardship. AmeriServ’s generosity and demonstrated commitment to saving lives in our region cannot be overstated and, on behalf of the Joyce Murtha Breast Care Center and our patients, I can’t thank AmeriServ enough.**ABOUT THE JOYCE MURTHA BREAST CARE CENTER –** The Joyce Murtha Breast Care Center (JMBCC) opened in February 2002 offering comprehensive and personalized breast care in one convenient location. The JMBCC exists to prevent and treat diseases of the breast and other conditions that can impact the lives of the women served. The tools and techniques used include digital mammography, ultrasound, breast biopsies, breast MRI, bone densitometry, genetic counseling, research studies, and a female breast surgeon on-site.**ABOUT AMERISERV FINANCIAL, INC. –** AmeriServ Financial, Inc. is the parent of AmeriServ Financial Bank, located in Johnstown, PA. The bank provides full-service banking and wealth management services through 16 community offices in southwestern Pennsylvania and Hagerstown, Maryland. The Company also operates loan production offices in Altoona and Monroeville, Pennsylvania. At September 30, 2024, AmeriServ had total assets of $1.4 billion and a book value of $6.55 per common share. AmeriServ Financial, Inc. is publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock exchange under the symbol ASRV.

###  West Chester Capital Advisors, Inc. Announces Rebrand, Name Change to AmeriServ Wealth Advisors, Inc.

November 8, 2024

JOHNSTOWN, Pa., Nov. 8, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- (NASDAQ: ASRV) – West Chester Capital Advisors, Inc., the registered investment advisor of AmeriServ Financial Bank, announced today that it has changed its name to AmeriServ Wealth Advisors, Inc. The name change and rebranding, which includes a new visual identity, web presence and enhanced positioning, is intended to better reflect the company's business and its strong partnership with AmeriServ Bank.

"We are excited to now be more closely aligned with our parent company. This name change enables us to capitalize on the brand equity associated with the AmeriServ name while continuing to provide investment advisory services to our clients," Frank Lapinsky, president, and CEO of AmeriServ Wealth Advisors, said.

He described the firm's performance as "our team of investment and wealth professionals brings over 100 years of assisting clients to plan for their present and future financial needs. We have a deep understanding of clients' needs, a history enabling them to identify and chart their investments goals and a strong commitment to providing an exceptional level of personal and professional service. This expertise coupled with the bank's almost 125-year history provides our clients with the reassurance and recognizability that we are committed to working with them through every stage of their financial life."

AmeriServ Wealth Advisors' investment management and advisory services range from individual portfolio management to pension and profit-sharing plans for individuals and institutions, including bank and trust companies, charitable organizations, and government entities. The firm's proactive, disciplined approach is also applied to the signature Pathroad Account® portfolios which are sponsored by AmeriServ Financial Bank and designed to produce solid long-term investment results for both equity and fixed income clients. The combined years of experience of the advisors allows for delivery of personalized services through one-on-one consultations with a local investment firm.

**About AmeriServ Wealth Advisors, Inc.**

AmeriServ Wealth Advisors, Inc. is an SEC-registered investment advisor with its principal place of business located in Johnstown, PA. It is a wholly owned subsidiary of AmeriServ Financial Bank®. AmeriServ Financial Bank is a wholly owned subsidiary of AmeriServ Financial, Inc., a publicly held bank holding company trading on the Nasdaq stock exchange under the symbol ASRV.

###  AmeriServ Joins Forces with Veterans Leadership Program to Provide Veterans with Backpacks and Needed Items

November 6, 2024

**Johnstown, PA (NASDAQ: ASRV)** – Forty-seven military service veterans received much needed travel backpacks and essential life-style items thanks to the AmeriServ Bank Cares Program and local bank staff. It is the culmination of a grass roots effort that mobilized AmeriServ staffers into collecting and donating backpacks to provide veterans with items needed to make the transition from active duty to civilian life. The backpacks were collected and distributed through a partnership with Veterans Leadership Program (VLP).AmeriServ representatives delivered backpacks to the Johnstown office of VLP on Wednesday, November 6, 2024. The office, located in the Hiram G. Andrews Center along Goucher Street in Johnstown, is one of three VLP offices servicing veterans in Pennsylvania, New York, and Ohio.AmeriServ president and CEO, Jeff Stopko was on hand to help deliver backpacks to the local VLP office. “It is no coincidence that our backpack collection project culminated with this delivery just days before we commemorate Veteran’s Day. The service men and women who selflessly serve our nation and protect our freedoms must be remembered and provided with the help they need when returning home. If these backpacks and the items we have collected provide them with one less thing to worry about while providing some level of comfort, we are helping them take the necessary steps toward a more certain future.”**ABOUT Veterans Leadership Program (VLP)** For 40 years, VLP has operated with a focus on empowering veterans to navigate the transition from service member to citizen by providing collaborative, supportive, and service-oriented expertiseand resources delivered through comprehensive programs and partnerships. VLP serves 7,200 veterans annually through comprehensive and holistic wellness, mental, emotional, and physical health, well-being, and safety programming and support for veterans and their subdivisions, in pursuit of their mission of helping veterans to reach their fullest potential in their civilian lives.For more information on how to make a monetary donation to VLP, visit veteransleadershipprogram.org/ways-to-give/donate or by calling 844-VLP-VETS (844.857-8387).**ABOUT AMERISERV FINANCIAL, INC. –** AmeriServ Financial, Inc. is the parent of AmeriServ Financial Bank, located in Johnstown, PA. The bank provides full-service banking and wealth management services through 16 community offices in southwestern Pennsylvania and Hagerstown, Maryland. The Company also operates loan production offices in Altoona and Monroeville, Pennsylvania. At September 30, 2024, AmeriServ had total assets of $1.4 billion and a book value of $6.55 per common share. AmeriServ Financial, Inc. is publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock exchange under the symbol ASRV.**ABOUT AMERISERV CARES** AmeriServ Cares is a workplace giving initiative spearheaded by the employees of AmeriServ Bank and AmeriServ Financial, Inc. The program assists staff with identifying organizations and opportunities within the company’s service area that need charitable donations and volunteers.

# Executive Management

#### 

Jeffrey A. StopkoPresident and CEO of Ameriserv Financial, Inc.jstopko@ameriserv.com

Mr. Jeffrey A. Stopko has served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of AmeriServ Financial, Inc. since March 24, 2015. Prior to his appointment as President and CEO, Mr. Stopko served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial and Administrative Officer of AmeriServ Financial, Inc. since March 2009 where he directed all administrative services to include finance, information technology, credit administration and human resources. Prior to that Mr. Stopko served as Chief Financial Officer and Principal Accounting Officer of AmeriServ Financial, Inc. since 1997 where he directed all financial and investment activities. He guided a major corporate balance sheet restructuring at AmeriServ that reduced the risk profile and provided the foundation for improved earnings. He is a licensed Certified Public Accountant with Big Four accounting experience. Mr. Stopko is a 1984 graduate of Bucknell University with a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration.

#### 

David A. FinuiPresident of Wealth Managementdfinui@ameriserv.com

Mr. David A. Finui was named as the President and Chief Executive Officer of AmeriServ Trust & Financial Services Co. in August of 2023. Prior to his appointment as President and CEO, Mr. Finui served as Executive Vice President, Director of Capital Management with direct oversight of the personal trust and financial services divisions at AmeriServ since 2016. He has over 44 years of experience in the trust and wealth management business and over 50 years experience in the financial sector. Mr. Finui holds an MBA from Indiana University of Pennsylvania and an undergraduate bachelor of science degree from the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown. He has also participated in several industry-leading trust schools.

#### 

Susan Tomera AngelettiSenior Vice President and Director of Corporate Marketing and Alternative Delivery Systemssangeletti@ameriserv.com

Ms. Angeletti joined AmeriServ in 2014 as senior vice president and director of corporate marketing and alternative delivery systems. She is responsible for all facets of marketing, including branding, product development and alternative delivery customer services. She holds an MBA from St. Francis University and a bachelor’s degree in journalism from the University of Pittsburgh. Susan is also an active board member of the Women's Help Center, headquartered in Johnstown, PA.

#### 

Michael BaylorExecutive Vice President and Chief Lending Officermbaylor@ameriserv.com

Mr. Baylor brings more than 40 years of experience to his role as executive vice president and chief lending officer for AmeriServ. He has an undergraduate degree in finance from West Virginia University and a Masters of Business Administration from Frostburg State University. Additionally, he has graduated from The Stonier Graduate School of Banking at the University of Delaware and from the National Commercial Lending School at the University of Oklahoma. Mr. Baylor is involved in various community and not for profit organizations that include the Greater Hagerstown Committee, the Chamber of Commerce, the National Wild Turkey Federation, the Izaak Walton League, Ducks Unlimited and the Washington County Community Foundation.

#### 

Laura FioreSenior Vice President and Chief Auditorlfiore@ameriserv.com

Ms. Fiore, a Certified Public Accountant and magna cum laude graduate of West Virginia University, joined AmeriServ's Audit Department in 2011 and was promoted to the position of Chief Auditor in 2020. She has held positions of increasing responsibility throughout her time at AmeriServ, including that of Vice President & Deputy Auditor immediately prior to her promotion. Ms. Fiore manages internal audits, audit committee and board of director reporting, and external audit examinations, communications and information requests. She is also responsible for requirements that underlie annual assessment of internal control over financial reporting. Prior to joining AmeriServ, Ms. Fiore was a Senior Auditor for KPMG.

#### 

Bettina D. FochlerSenior Vice President and Chief Credit Officercfochler@ameriserv.com

Ms. Fochler has served the AmeriServ team since 2001 and has been the Chief Credit Officer of AmeriServ Financial, Inc., since January 2017. She brings more than 20 years of Credit Risk Management experience. Ms. Fochler previously held the position of Credit Manager where she was responsible for oversight of the underwriting of commercial loan transactions, as well as being integrally involved in asset quality and risk management. She earned a Bachelor of Arts Degree in business from the University of Pittsburgh in 2000. For many years, Ms. Fochler led the bank’s fundraising efforts for St. Vincent dePaul, specifically the Food for Families project. More recently, she has taken on the role of Westmont Hilltop Cheerleading Booster Secretary. 

#### 

Michael LynchExecutive Vice President; Chief Financial and Investment Officer; Chief Risk Officermlynch@ameriserv.com

As executive vice president, chief financial and investment officer, and chief risk officer, Mr. Lynch brings more than 40 years of experience to his role at AmeriServ. Prior to assuming his current role in 2015, Mr. Lynch served as vice president and chief investment and risk officer. He holds a bachelor of arts in business from the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown, as well as an MBA from Indiana University of Pennsylvania. Mr. Lynch serves on the American Heart Association's executive leadership team of Cambria & Somerset Counties, serves as a foundation board member for Penn Highlands Community College, and is a board member of the non-profit Worth the Weight.

#### 

Kerri L. MuellerSenior Vice President of Retail Bankingkmueller@ameriserv.com

Ms. Mueller serves as Senior Vice President of Retail for AmeriServ Financial, a role in which she is responsible for all operational aspects of the community banking offices and manages all operational policies and procedures to ensure the safety and soundness of the Bank. She is responsible for the management, sales and service initiatives of all community offices. Her duties include providing leadership to the retail sales staff and formulating new growth and sales strategies while fostering both business and consumer customer relationships. Mueller earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Business, with a Minor in Communication from the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown. She obtained her Master’s degree in Social Work from the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown in December of 2011. Ms. Mueller currently serves as a member of the Executive Committee as Chairman of the Board for the Cambria County Regional Chamber of Commerce. In addition, she is actively involved in the Pennsylvania Bankers Association, having served on the Women in Banking Committee and the PA Bankers Champions Program, and is a graduate of the PA Banker Leadership Institute. She is currently an instructor for PBA Advanced School of Banking and will serve as the incoming Chairman of the Board for the Group 6 region for the PA Bankers Association.

#### 

Michele ScanlanSenior Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officermscanlan@ameriserv.com

Senior Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer Michele Scanlan joined the AmeriServ team in March of 2021. She serves as the leader for collective bargaining, human resources, and organizational development. She also serves as the corporation’s chief labor negotiator in addition to leading all human capital-related objectives associated with long-term growth strategy. Ms. Scanlan has a bachelor of science degree in human resource management from Geneva College, as well as a master of arts degree in human resource management and industrial relations from St. Francis University. She holds certifications as a Senior Professional in Human Resources (SPHR), an SHRM Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP), and as a Strategic Human Resources Business Partner. Ms. Scanlan also serves as a Volunteer Board Member for Highland Health, a free and charitable care medical clinic.

#### 

Catherine TorokSenior Vice President and Chief Information Officerctorok@ameriserv.com

Catherine Torok assumed the role of Chief Information Officer in November of 2021. She oversees all aspects of information technology, including operation of existing technology platforms along with providing direction and leadership for the evaluation and implementation of new technologies. Ms. Torok earned a master's degree in education from Indiana University of Pennsylvania and a bachelor of science degree in computer science/math from the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown. She also holds a BICSI Registered Communications Distribution Designer (RCDD) and an ISC2, Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification. Ms. Torok is an officer in the Penn Highlands Chapter of the ISC2 and serves on the Board of Directors of the Cambria County Library System.
